item.title: Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 12 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Don‚Äôt miss a snap! Find the full Week 12 schedule for watching college football today on TV. We cover channel lineups and which games are must-watch matchups.

The post Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 12 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
We’re all tired of hearing the headlines about the standoff between Disney and YouTube TV. They’re holding off, refusing to come to the table, and making things worse for everyone involved!

But at CableTV.com, we try to be optimistic about these sorts of things. And after a weekend that featured the most unlikely of unlikely scenarios—we saw last-second wins, a Curt Cignetti smile, and whatever Wisconsin–Washington was—who’s to say we can’t get YouTube TV and the House of Mouse back to the bargaining table? (Was there another long-running and stupid dispute in the news that we missed?)

For the Week 12 edition of the CableTV.com College Football What To Watch Guide, we’ll appreciate Mess, try to believe the hype, and explore Guy-ology.

Jump to:

  • CableTV.com’s Game of the Week
  • Week 12’s best college football games
  • College football Week 12 TV schedule

Interested in college football games today?

Subscribe to our email newsletter for the latest football takes, TV subscription deals, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

CableTV.com’s Expert Viewing Guide: Still can’t watch college football games because of YouTube TV and ESPN’s blackout dispute?

Check out our main How to Stream College Football guide to find the easiest and free YouTube TV alternatives to watch college football games this Saturday. We also cover popular YouTube TV streaming alternatives like Fubo, Sling, and DIRECTV.

CableTV.com’s college football Game of the Week

Watch Texas vs. Georgia | ABC

Why you should watch: Much like Arch Manning’s per-game quarterback rating, the discourse around Texas has been swinging up and down all season. And just like that one annoying Kill Tony guy you know who moved to Austin and got really into crypto, the top-10 Longhorns are back up this weekend.

Week 10’s 34–31 win over Vanderbilt was Manning’s best conference game of the season, as he threw for more than 300 yards alongside three touchdowns and no picks. Texas’ retooled offensive line also kept Manning upright and powered running back Quintrevion Wisner to his best performance (75 yards at 4.2 yards per attempt and a touchdown) since the Red River Rivalry.

WINGO GOT WHEELS üí®‚ÄºÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/2jGA7HiPvJ

— Texas Football (@TexasFootball) November 1, 2025

That said, Texas’s win streak has coincided with Steve Sarkisian laying off the play-calling pedal. As noted by Burnt Orange Nation and Saturday Down South, Texas has heavily relied on the screen and YAC game over its four-game win streak—most of Manning’s yardage against Vanderbilt came after the catch, and they’ve dialed back their downfield passing attempts considerably.

Can this year’s rickety edition of Georgia force Texas not to be screen merchants? Those TikToks of Kirby Smart dog-cussing at practice finally paid off with a vintage 41–21 bulldozing of Mississippi State last weekend—Georgia’s secondary didn’t allow a touchdown, and their ground game cracked 300 yards for the first time this season. To keep their playoff hopes alive, Texas will need a complete game from Manning and enough defensive juice to hold Georgia’s passing game in check.

How to watch #10 Texas at #5 Georgia

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ABC
Location: Sanford Stadium in Athens, GA
Point spread: Georgia by 6.5

Stream on Fubo

CableTV.com’s Homefield Apparel of the week

Based in Indianapolis, Homefield offers officially licensed college apparel with exclusive vintage designs that draw from the history of more than 150 colleges. This week’s Homefield picks highlight vault pulls, bomber jackets, and more from Homefield’s Georgia and Texas collections.

Want to upgrade your gameday fit? Click the link below to check out Homefield’s collections, and use promo code CABLETV to save 15% off your first order.

Buy Homefield College Football Shirts

CableTV.com’s top college football games for Week 12

Watch Ohio vs. Western Michigan | ESPN2
Watch Buffalo vs. Central Michigan | CBS Sports Network

Why you should watch: Feel the MACtion this week with a solid matchup slate featuring teams at the top of the MAC conference standings.

The 6–1 Bobcats are sitting pretty with a three-game win streak, and they’ll head to Kalamazoo to face a Broncos team coming off a good win over Central Michigan. Up the road in Mount Pleasant, the Chips are narrowly favored over a Bulls team that rebounded from an Akron upset with a blowout win over Bowling Green.

How to watch Ohio at Western Michigan

 vs.  

Date: Tuesday, Nov. 11
Time: 8:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Waldo Stadium in Kalamazoo, MI
Point spread: Ohio by 1.5

How to watch Buffalo at Central Michigan

 vs. 

Date: Wednesday, Nov. 12
Time: 7:00 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS Sports Network
Location: Kelly/Shorts Stadium in Mount Pleasant, MI
Point spread: CMU by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch West Virginia vs. Arizona State | TNT, truTV, HBO Max

Why you should watch: RichRod teams have typically hit another gear when they’ve found their dual-threat guy. 2024 Jacksonville State’s Tyler Huff was the latest in a proud lineage of RichRod Guys like Pat White, Denard Robinson, and Khalil Tate.

We’re not yet ready to declare West Virginia quarterback Scotty Fox Jr. the latest RichRod Guy, but since taking over under center, he’s put up strong Guy-Adjacent stat lines. In wins over Houston and Colorado, Fox cracked the 50-yard mark on the ground and showed a wily amount of speed.

I see your Mason Heintschel and raise you one Scotty Fox. #HailWV 🏈 https://t.co/UUuUJHt9GQ pic.twitter.com/ngVAGEVrkj

— The Beard 🕶️🎙️ ☕️ (@EerBeard) November 2, 2025

At 4–6 with a season-ending matchup against Texas Tech awaiting them, West Virginia’s likely focusing on next year over a long-shot bowl bid. But Fox could potentially make things interesting against a Sun Devils squad that started Jeff Sims at quarterback last week and still eked out a win.

How to watch West Virginia at Arizona State

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 1:00 p.m. ET
Channel: TNT, truTV, HBO Max
Location: Mountain America Stadium in Tempe, AZ
Point spread: Arizona State by 10.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Oklahoma vs. Alabama | ABC

Why you should watch: John Mateer booked his postseason reservations, and he’ll be damned if he has to call customer service and wait for a refund.

Mateer’s productivity has fallen off since he returned against Texas, but thanks to the Sooners defense, an improving group of running backs, and run game usage that hasn’t yet cleaved him in half (Mateer’s, somehow, tied for first in carries), the 7–2 Sooners are still holding onto the playoff bubble.

The odds are stacked against Oklahoma for the upset, as they’ll head to Tuscaloosa for this year’s matchup. But if they can sneak by Alabama—who has alternated between methodical dispatches and narrow wins all season, if you’re looking to wishcast—the Sooners close out the year with winnable games against Mizzou and the dried husk of LSU.

How to watch #11 Oklahoma at #4 Alabama

 vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ABC
Location: Bryant-Denny Stadium in Tuscaloosa, AL
Point spread: Alabama by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch South Florida vs. Navy | ESPN2
Watch Virginia vs. Duke | ESPN2

Why you should watch: If your school’s conference begins with the letter A, be prepared to bookmark win scenario spreadsheets and pop some aspirin this month.

Down in the American, Memphis all but fell out of the conference title race after their loss to Tulane last week. South Florida and Navy face off this week for the chance to grab first place in the American standings, and the Bulls need a win to hold off Tulane for a spot in the conference title game. (This applies double for 6–3 East Carolina, who’s technically part of the American’s four-way tie for second place and has the chance to do the funniest thing.)

Up in the ACC, Playoff Iowa may have died on the vine last weekend, but it doesn’t mean we can’t move on to our new wish: 7–5 Duke reaching the ACC title game! Despite dropping games to teams like Georgia Tech and UConn, the Blue Devils still have a viable path to Charlotte.

Here is the incredibly realistic scenario where Duke goes 7–5 and makes it to the ACC title game.

The only notable upset required is Virginia Tech beating Virginia.


— Ryan McCrystal (@ryanmccrystal.bsky.social) November 10, 2025 at 1:31 PM

Duke ends the year with winnable games against UNC and Wake Forest and has second place to themselves in the conference standings. Coupled with other ACC contenders like Georgia Tech and Pitt facing off and picking themselves off in the coming weeks, Duke simply needs a few breaks to be the last man standing—ESPN’s FPI even gives them the second-best odds of winning the conference title.

If that wasn’t enough, they’ll face off against a reeling Cavs team that just picked up its first conference loss and might not have quarterback Chandler Morris. The ACC might be a mid-filled disaster right now, but we’ll forgive them (and root for Duke, even!) if they can cause a Duke butterfly effect that gets James Madison into the playoffs. Playoff chaos!

How to watch South Florida at Navy

 vs.  

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 12:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium in Annapolis, MD
Point spread: South Florida by 10.5

How to watch Virginia vs. Duke

 vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Wallace Wade Stadium in Durham, NC
Point spread: Duke by 6.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Kennesaw State vs. Jacksonville State | ESPNU

Why you should watch: Wrap up your night with a solid nightcap that’ll determine first place on the Conference USA standings.

7–2 Kennesaw State strung together seven straight wins on the back of an elite defense that’s borderline top-50 by SP+. As for 6–3 Jacksonville State, the Gamecocks have been playing with fire with a string of one-possession wins against middling squads, but their ground game is once again a top-five unit nationally.

How to watch Kennesaw State at Jacksonville State

 vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 8:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPNU
Location: AmFirst Stadium in Jacksonville, AL
Point spread: Kennesaw State by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

The U.S. Men’s National Soccer Team (USMNT) officially dates back to 1916. Despite its long history, the national team has never won the FIFA Men’s World Cup. Its biggest tournament wins have come in the CONCACAF Gold Cup and Nations League.

As we approach the 2026 World Cup, there’s no better time to start following the USMNT. Mauricio Pochettino has taken charge, and the team is ready to step up its game. That’s why we’ve gathered all the necessary details to watch the team in action.

Keep scrolling for a complete look at the U.S. men’s soccer schedule, channel listings, and recommended TV services.

Jump to:

  • USMNT channels
  • USMNT TV schedule
  • Best ways to watch the USMNT
  • Watch the USMNT for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have USMNT games?

You can watch most USMNT games on FOX, FS1, TBS, and TNT. But you may need access to streaming services HBO Max and Paramount+ for complete English-language coverage.

Spanish-language channels like Telemundo, TUDN, UniMás, UNIVERSO, and Univision also show USMNT games. At the same time, most USMNT matchups stream en Español across Peacock and ViX.

USMNT TV schedule

The USMNT competes at various times throughout the year, usually during international windows established by FIFA. But most of the national team’s high-profile matchups happen during the summer.

Stay up to date on all the action with the USMNT schedule listed below, featuring upcoming kickoff times and channel details.

Opponent Competition Date Time (ET) English channels Spanish channels

Data effective as of post date. Compatible device and internet connection required. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Pros

  • Key U.S. Soccer channels
  • ESPN+ and Disney+ included
  • Unlimited cloud DVR

Cons

  • Small sports channel lineup
  • Only two simultaneous streams allowed

Hulu + Live TV is our favorite way to get the traditional TV channels that show USMNT matches. Starting at $81.99 a month, the live TV streaming service is not cheap. But it’s perfect for those who want U.S. Soccer coverage alongside popular entertainment networks.

Hulu + Live TV’s FOX Sports channels set you up for every World Cup and Gold Cup game. You’ll also get select USMNT and USWNT friendlies through TBS and TNT. As a bonus, the service includes every ESPN channel and ESPN+ at no extra cost, giving you access to many soccer leagues from around the globe.

Unfortunately, watching U.S. Soccer on Hulu + Live TV means you’ll miss out on games that stream exclusively on HBO Max and Paramount+. But you can get standalone subscriptions to both services and cancel anytime.

View Hulu + Live TV Plans

Exclusive U.S. Soccer Games: HBO Max

Editorial rating (2.6/5)
Price:
$16.99‚Äì$20.99/mo.
USMNT content:
20+ USMNT and USWNT games per year
Features:
Large on-demand library with many sports documentaries
View Plans for HBO Max
Read HBO Max review

Data effective as of post date. Compatible device and internet connection required. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Pros

  • Every USMNT and USWNT friendly
  • Large TV and movie library

Cons

  • Limited live sports
  • Expensive pricing

HBO Max entered the live sports scene in early 2023 by streaming live USMNT and USWNT friendlies—including the SheBelieves Cup. While it had some initial hiccups, the Warner Bros. Discovery platform gradually resolved its issues. Unfortunately, watching live sports on HBO Max requires a higher-tier plan, so you’ll need a Standard or Premium base plan to access its B/R Sports hub.

International friendlies don’t happen regularly throughout the year. Therefore, committing to an annual HBO Max subscription for live soccer is not the most cost-effective choice. But HBO Max offers an extensive library of on-demand TV shows and movies to keep you entertained between match days.

HBO Max is pricier than other on-demand streaming services. So, if you’re seeking a cheaper alternative, we recommend Peacock. For $10.99 per month, Peacock streams the same U.S. Soccer games with Spanish-language commentary—more on that in the next section.

View HBO Max Plans

Best en Español: Peacock

Editorial rating (3.8/5)
Price:
$10.99‚Äì$16.99/mo.

Friendlies and FIFA tournaments with Spanish-language commentary
Features:

View Plans for Peacock
Read Peacock review

Data effective as of post date. Compatible device and internet connection required. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Pros

  • Every USMNT and USWNT friendly
  • Complete World Cup and Olympic coverage
  • Inexpensive pricing

Cons

  • No CONCACAF tournament coverage
  • Limited original content

Peacock is a fantastic option for watching U.S. Soccer games, offering affordability and diverse competitions. It’s home to U.S. Soccer’s international friendlies and FIFA’s World Cup tournaments with Spanish-language commentary. Plus, it offers complete access to the Summer Olympics—featuring men’s and women’s soccer events.

Beyond national team coverage, Peacock streams a wide array of live sports. There are Sunday Night Football games, Premier League matches, PGA Tour tournaments, and more. In other words, don’t sleep on Peacock. It’s a major contender in the streaming sports category, rivaling the likes of ESPN+.

View Peacock Plans

Pro tip: Most USMNT games that don’t stream on Peacock are available on ViX. The Spanish-language streaming service hosts CONCACAF tournament coverage across its free and premium plans.

How to watch the USMNT for free

Get Free Local Channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase*)
USMNT channels:
FOX and Telemundo
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

*CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

There isn’t an easy way to watch USMNT matchups for free. But you can watch occasional games without a TV subscription by using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to pick up your local FOX station.

FOX is responsible for showing Gold Cup and World Cup matches. Because those competitions don’t happen annually, FOX’s U.S. Soccer coverage is inconsistent. But having an OTA antenna is still useful for watching MLS, Premier League, and UEFA Champions League games.

Before choosing an antenna, enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map. The tool will help illustrate which channels are available in your area and the type of antenna range you need. Then, head to our Best OTA Antennas page to browse a diverse selection of antennas.

Hulu + Live TV is the best for watching men’s soccer

The USMNT plays in many competitions—including international friendlies and (sometimes) World Cup fixtures. The channels and streaming platforms showing games vary based on the competition type and your language preference. Most national team games air across FOX, FS1, TBS, and TNT, but you may also need HBO Max and Paramount+ to round out your English-language coverage.

Hulu + Live TV is great for watching USMNT games that air on traditional channels. The live TV streaming service even comes with ESPN+ and unlimited DVR storage for an enhanced viewing experience. However, Hulu + Live TV plans start at $81.99 a month, so adding HBO Max and Paramount+ to your lineup makes things exceptionally pricey.

If you want to save money, a combination of Peacock Premium ($10.99 a month) and ViX Premium ($4.99–$8.99 a month) will get you most USMNT games with Spanish-language commentary. You’ll also get access to several other live soccer matches and a wide selection of on-demand TV shows and movies.

How to watch the USMNT FAQ

Who is televising US soccer?

CBS Sports, FOX Sports, and Warner Bros. Discovery Sports are the main English-language broadcasters for games involving U.S. national soccer teams. The specific channels and streaming platforms that air these matches vary depending on the type of competition. For example, all international friendlies stream on HBO Max, while World Cup games air on FOX and FS1.

How can I watch USA soccer on my phone?

There isn‚Äôt a single app that streams every USA international soccer game. But you can watch matches on your phone or tablet through live TV streaming services like Hulu + Live TV, Sling TV, and YouTube TV. Select matchups also stream on HBO Max, Paramount+, and Peacock.

Can I watch US soccer without cable?

Yes, you can watch USMNT and USWNT games with any live TV streaming service that carries channels like FOX, FS1, and TNT. Standalone streaming services like HBO Max, Paramount+, and Peacock also show live U.S. national soccer matches.

Why you should trust us

Our experts conducted extensive research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch USMNT games on TV. We compiled a comprehensive list of channels airing U.S. Soccer games and upcoming international competitions. With that information, we compared TV providers based on channel lineups, pricing, and user-friendliness.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: üî™ The Ultimate Struggle: Finding the Perfect True Crime Binge
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hastings
item.description:
I‚Äôm a total true crime fanatic, and figuring out where to get my fix is basically a full time job. I did the deep dive for you: here is my breakdown of the best true crime documentaries and series streaming on Netflix, Max, and Hulu right now!

The post 🔪 The Ultimate Struggle: Finding the Perfect True Crime Binge appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In search of the perfect true crime binge-watch

If you are like me, your ideal night involves a comfy blanket, snacks, and a horrifying documentary that makes you rethink trusting everyone. I mean, I am obsessed with true crime, but honestly, finding the best place to watch is a whole investigation itself.

True crime is everywhere now. It’s not just on the classic cable channels anymore. Every major streaming platform is dropping huge docuseries, which makes it super hard to figure out which subscription is actually worth the money for our specific obsession.

So, I did the work for you. I dug through Netflix, HBO Max, and Hulu to give you my honest ranking of where to get the best true crime fix. Whether you like cults, scammers, or old-school serial killers, I have you covered.

Looking for even more picks? Don’t miss TV critic Randy Harward’s weekly What To Watch guide for the freshest streaming recs.

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

1. The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst (2015)

Okay, if you haven’t watched this, seriously, stop everything. I’m talking about The Jinx, the original HBO documentary that basically changed the game for true crime. It follows eccentric real estate heir Robert Durst, who has been linked to three separate deaths over decades.

I swear, the storytelling is a masterclass in suspense. They have unprecedented access, and I felt like I was right there with the filmmakers trying to figure out what was going on. The original ending is one of the most famous moments in TV history. I literally screamed. And now, there’s a follow up series, The Jinx: Part Two, that brings the story into the present day. You need to watch the original first, though. Trust me on this. It’s good.

Where to stream The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst

Watch Options

2. American Nightmare (2024)

Netflix started the year strong with American Nightmare, and it’s a total binge. It’s a three part docuseries about Denise Huskins and Aaron Quinn, whose terrifying home invasion and kidnapping story was initially dismissed by the police and the media as a Gone Girl hoax.

The whole thing is infuriating. I kept yelling at my TV because you see how the investigators completely failed the victims by immediately assuming they were lying. The documentary uses police interrogation footage and interviews to systematically tear down the “hoax” theory. It’s a raw look at how quickly public opinion and flawed policing can turn a victim’s life into a total nightmare.

Where to stream American Nightmare

Watch Options

3. Under the Banner of Heaven (2022)

Under the Banner of Heaven is one of my favorite scripted true crime dramas right now, even though I usually prefer docs. It stars Andrew Garfield (yes, Spider-Man!) as a detective investigating the horrific murder of a mother and her baby daughter in a tight-knit Latter Day Saint community.

What makes it so gripping is how it ties the shocking crime back to the dark, violent origins and radical fundamentalism of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (FLDS Church). The story is intense, the acting is incredible, and it’s the kind of show that makes you want to immediately look up all the real-life historical context. It’s heavy, but it’s also a must-see for a deep dive into the power of extreme belief.

Where to stream Under the Banner of Heaven

Watch Options

4. Keep Sweet: Pray and Obey (2022)

If you’re into the scary side of cults, Keep Sweet: Pray and Obey is a four episode deep dive into the FLDS Church and its polygamist leader, Warren Jeffs.

This series is so unsettling. I’d heard the name Warren Jeffs before, but the documentary uses incredible archival footage and chilling first hand accounts from the women and children who escaped. They tell their stories with such honesty, detailing the abuse and control they lived under. It’s a tough watch because of the subject matter, but it’s an important look at the resilience of the survivors.

Where to stream Keep Sweet: Pray and Obey

Watch Options

5. Candy (2022)

I love a good 1980s period piece, and Candy on Hulu delivers. It’s another excellent scripted series about the notorious murder of Betty Gore by her friend, Candy Montgomery, in a small Texas town in 1980.

Jessica Biel as Candy is perfection; she plays this outwardly perfect, slightly too eager-to-please housewife so well. The show does a great job of illustrating how simmering resentments and secret affairs in a quiet suburb can escalate into something unimaginably violent. It’s a compelling psychological drama that makes you wonder what your neighbors are really up to.

Where to stream Candy

Watch Options

The post 🔪 The Ultimate Struggle: Finding the Perfect True Crime Binge appeared first on CableTV.com.

The post NFL Schedule This Week: Your TV Guide to Every Week 11 Game appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
With the NFL season hitting Week 11, the power structure has flipped on its head again. One of the biggest AFC storylines is that the Patriots are on a seven-game win streak, a run that’s propelled them past the struggling Bills and Chiefs. This has created a complex AFC playoff picture, highlighted by the perplexing 8–2 Broncos, who continue to win despite an offense that only shows up on occasion.

Meanwhile, the NFC is an absolute heavyweight war. The Seattle Seahawks and Los Angeles Rams are fighting for the conference’s top seed, and their Week 11 showdown is the must-watch game of the week. Not to be outdone, Dan Campbell has retaken offensive play-calling for the Lions, turning them back into a nuclear weapon just in time for a major clash with the Eagles. Expect more fireworks as this week’s matchups play out.

To help you tune in, I’ve laid out the complete NFL schedule for Week 11 below. It has all the game times and channel listings you’ll need, plus my full preview of that monster Seahawks–Rams clash.

CableTV.com’s NFL Game of the Week

Seattle Seahawks at Los Angeles Rams | FOX

Coverage begins Sunday, November 16, at 4:05 p.m. ET: For the second consecutive week, my must-watch game resides squarely in the NFC West, and for good reason. With the Seahawks and the Rams sitting at a superb 7–2, this battle at SoFi Stadium is both a high-stakes divisional rivalry match and a fight for the NFC’s No. 1 seed.

Both teams have been on a tear, with the Rams riding a four-game win streak and the Seahawks not having trailed in a game since Week 6. But it’s the quarterback battle that has me hooked. Matthew Stafford is playing like a man possessed, throwing 13 touchdowns with zero interceptions over the last three games and building a legitimate MVP case. The problem for him? He’s facing a Seahawks defense that’s tied for second in the NFL with 32 sacks, and they get that pressure without blitzing.

On the other side, Sam Darnold is having a career-defining, hyper-efficient season for a Seattle offense that ranks third in scoring. This is a fascinating schematic chess match. The Rams’ defense is also stout against the run, which means the Seahawks will need to rely on Darnold’s poise to win the game.

Joe Davis and Greg Olsen will be on the call for this game on FOX. But keep in mind that this is a regional broadcast, so out-of-market viewers will need NFL Sunday Ticket.

NFL Schedule This Week FAQ

We're now in Week 11 of the 2025 NFL season. This week is notable for featuring the final international matchup of the year, a Commanders‚ÄìDolphins showdown at Santiago Bernab√©u Stadium in Madrid, Spain.

Which NFL teams have a bye this week?

Who is the best team in the NFL today?

Right now, the Seattle Seahawks (7‚Äì2) have soared to the top of the NFL Power Rankings, followed closely by the Los Angeles Rams (7‚Äì2). The Indianapolis Colts (8‚Äì2) still have the AFC's best record, and the Philadelphia Eagles (7‚Äì2) are also in that top-tier conversation.

Why you should trust us

2025 awards shows FAQ

What awards shows are coming up?

The next big awards ceremony will be the CMA Awards, which air November 19 on ABC.

Where can I watch awards shows?

You can watch many awards shows on local channels: For example, the Oscars air on ABC in March, and the Grammys air on CBS in February. Some awards shows also post clips to their websites or YouTube channels. For a full list of awards shows and the places you can watch them, check out our 2024 awards show schedule.

How can I watch the Oscars after it airs?

After the ceremony airs live on ABC, the Oscars usually goes to Hulu for on-demand viewing. However, the listing will go away after a short time.

Is Hulu streaming the Grammys?

Yes, you can stream the Grammys live on Hulu as long as you have a Hulu + Live TV subscription. You can also watch the ceremony anywhere you get CBS, whether through cable, a live streaming service, or an over-the-air (OTA) antenna. It will also be live on Paramount+.

Is an Emmy the same as an Oscar?

No, an Emmy is not the same as an Oscar. The Emmys are awarded for achievement in television, while the Oscars are awarded for achievement in film.

What are the Golden Globes vs. Oscars?

Both the Golden Globes and the Oscars recognize achievement in film, but the Golden Globes also includes achievement in television. It's helpful to think of it as a combination between the Emmys and the Oscars.

Let’s start watching!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores Final: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Copa Libertadores final kicks off on November 29. Our guide covers how to watch Palmeiras vs. Flamengo live on U.S. TV channels and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores Final: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
South American club football reaches its absolute peak on Saturday, November 29. The 2025 Copa Libertadores final features a heavyweight showdown between Palmeiras and Flamengo, live from the Estadio Monumental in Lima, Peru.

With continental domination on the line, you can expect this to be a hard-fought battle by two clubs whose rivalry has only intensified in recent years. Both Palmeiras and Flamengo have won this trophy three times, and the winner of this edition will become the most decorated Brazilian club in the tournament’s history. As if that wasn’t enough, it’s a rematch of the 2021 final that saw Palmeiras win in extra time.

For fans in the U.S., finding this game on TV can be a challenge. You won’t see it on your local channels or the main ESPN or FOX networks. To help you get ready for the opening whistle, I’ve broken down exactly where to tune in and the best ways to stream it live.

2025 Copa Libertadores Final

Matchup: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo
Date: Saturday, Nov. 29
Time: 4:00 p.m. ET
Channels: beIN SPORTS, beIN SPORTS en Español

Stream Free on Fubo

Get your TV set for kickoff!

You won’t want to miss this electrifying CONMEBOL club final. Enter your zip code below to see your local internet and TV provider options.

What U.S. channel has the Copa Libertadores final?

You can watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores final live on beIN SPORTS in the U.S. Meanwhile, the Spanish-language broadcast will be on beIN SPORTS en Español. Both channels will have complete pre- and post-game coverage.

Best TV plans for watching the Copa Libertadores final

The biggest hurdle for U.S. fans watching the Copa Libertadores final is that its exclusive home, beIN SPORTS, is notoriously hard to get. As I’ve found in my provider research, many of the most popular live TV services don’t even carry the channel. To solve that problem, I’ve analyzed over 13 TV providers to find the best (and cheapest) ways to get the channel in time for this month’s final.

Best overall: Fubo

Fubo is the best and most straightforward option for watching the Copa Libertadores final. The main reason is that you get beIN SPORTS in its standard Pro plan, so you don’t have to hunt for a special add-on. This one subscription also gets you a ton of other must-have sports channels (like ESPN, FS1, and CBS Sports Network) and unlimited cloud DVR storage.

Now, let’s talk about the price, which is the main downside. Fubo is a premium service, and even if you get a sign-up deal, you must factor in taxes and the dreaded regional sports fee. That fee can add up to $16.99 a month, depending on your location, which is a hefty hidden cost. It’s a fantastic, all-in-one service, but that extra fee is a tough pill to swallow.

View Fubo Plans

Cheapest: Sling TV

For the most affordable way to watch Copa Libertadores matches, I recommend Sling TV. The live TV streaming service offers a standalone Soccer Pass subscription for just $7.99 a month. This gets you every beIN SPORTS channel to see the Flamengo–Palmeiras final, plus other tournaments like the Copa Sudamericana.

I’ve always appreciated Sling TV because it’s a basic, no-frills service that just works. It doesn’t have many flashy features, but in my own testing, I’ve always had a smooth live stream experience. If you just want the Copa final without a complicated, expensive package, this is the most cost-effective route.

View Sling TV Plans

Niche alternative: Fanatiz

If you’re a die-hard South American fútbol fan who doesn’t care for a comprehensive live TV plan, then Fanatiz is another direct option. This is a bare-bones streaming service built specifically for soccer lovers. To watch the Copa Libertadores final, you must navigate its confusing packages and find the Front Row Monthly plan ($12.99/mo.), which includes beIN SPORTS programming.

Unfortunately, Fanatiz is a classic “you get what you pay for” experience. I find the app and website interface to be pretty messy and sometimes glitchy, which is frustrating during live events. Still, it’s compatible with major devices like Amazon Fire TV, Apple TV, and Roku.

View Fanatiz Plans

How to watch the Copa Libertadores final for free

Since the game is on a premium channel, your only (legal) free option is to use a live TV streaming service free trial.

My top recommendation is Fubo’s five-day free trial, as its Pro and Elite plans include beIN SPORTS. If you time it right, you can sign up on Black Friday, watch the final on Saturday, and still have a few days to explore the service before your time’s up. That’ll keep you busy with all the major TV events happening over Thanksgiving weekend.

International broadcast details for the Copa Libertadores final

For international fans, Copa Libertadores broadcast rights vary by country since CONMEBOL sells them in separate packages worldwide. This means you can find the final on popular platforms in many countries, from free-to-air channels in Brazil to dedicated TV services across the globe.

To help you find your local feed, I’ve compiled a brief overview of the official broadcasters in major countries.

Copa Libertadores final broadcasters by country

  • Argentina (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Australia (beIN SPORTS)
  • Brazil (Globoplay)
  • Canada (beIN SPORTS)
  • Chile (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Colombia (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Mexico (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Spain (LaLiga+)
  • United Kingdom (BBC iPlayer)
  • United States (beIN SPORTS)

How to watch the Copa Libertadores final FAQ

What is the Copa Libertadores?

The Copa Libertadores is the largest club soccer tournament in South America. Organized by CONMEBOL, it's the equivalent of Europe's UEFA Champions League, and the winner qualifies for the FIFA Club World Cup.

Who is playing in the 2025 Copa Libertadores final?

This year's Copa Libertadores final is an all-Brazilian matchup between SE Palmeiras of S√£o Paulo and CR Flamengo of Rio de Janeiro. Both teams compete in the Campeonato Brasileiro S√©rie A.

What time does the Copa Libertadores final start?

The 2025 final kicks off on Saturday, November 29, at 4:00 p.m. ET.

Can I watch the Copa Libertadores final on Paramount+?

No, Copa Libertadores games don't stream on Paramount+ in the U.S. Instead, you'll need access to beIN SPORTS.

How can I watch a replay of the Copa Libertadores final?

Most streaming services that carry beIN SPORTS will offer an on-demand replay, especially live TV services with DVR capabilities. You can also catch free highlights and clips on the CONMEBOL Libertadores and beIN SPORTS USA YouTube channels.

Game day starts here!

  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
It‚Äôs survival of the fittest as Major League Soccer (MLS) clubs fight for a place in the MLS Cup Final. The MLS Playoffs will air on MLS Season Pass and FOX Sports networks starting in October, with the grand finale in December.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream on MLS Season Pass

I know some people out there think Major League Soccer (MLS) is the annoying stepchild of European soccer. But if you ask me, it’s the playoffs when these talented players really shine.

It’s survival of the fittest as clubs fight for a place in the 2025 MLS Cup Final. The MLS Playoffs will air on MLS Season Pass and FOX Sports networks from October to December, with the grand finale on Saturday, December 6.

This season, the playoffs continue last year’s format of 18 playoff teams. The top seven clubs from the Eastern and Western Conferences qualify for Round One, while the eighth and ninth seeds from each conference must first battle it out in the Wild Card Round.

Keep reading to see what specific channels you’ll need to watch the playoffs and how you can tune in for free.

Jump to:

  • MLS Playoffs channels
  • MLS Playoffs schedule
  • Watch the MLS Playoffs for free

Score the best TV provider in your area

Don’t miss a single minute of the MLS Playoffs. Enter your zip code below to see the top TV providers available for your home.

What channels are the MLS Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLS Playoffs will stream on MLS Season Pass, with select broadcasts airing on FOX and FS1. MLS Season Pass features English- and Spanish-language commentary, but Fox Deportes also shows playoff games en Español.

Pro tip: International MLS fans can watch the MLS Playoffs on MLS Season Pass, while select games will also air on TSN and RDS in Canada.

MLS Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLS Playoffs begin with wild card matches on Wednesday, October 22, after what will surely be an exhilarating Decision Day on Saturday, October 18. As usual, the playoffs will feature intense action that culminates in the MLS Cup Final—set for Saturday, December 6.

I’ve laid out the TV schedule below for viewing details on all the playoff matches. I’ll update it with teams and times as more information becomes available.

Best TV plans for watching the MLS Playoffs

For my money, MLS Season Pass on Apple TV is the best way to watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs. At $14.99 a month or $9.99 for the remainder of the season, it’s an inexpensive viewing option for anyone with reliable internet. You also get in-depth studio coverage and on-demand access to every game—a great feature if you can’t tune in live.

If you prefer a more comprehensive TV provider, we recommend Hulu + Live TV because it comes with every FOX Sports channel and ESPN+. That’ll get you select MLS playoff games and live coverage of many other soccer leagues—including the German Bundesliga, La Liga, and the USL Championship. You’ll even get complete access to other marquee soccer tournaments like the NWSL Playoffs and FIFA Club World Cup.

How to watch the MLS Playoffs for free

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

There’s no way to watch the entire MLS Playoffs for free. But some playoff games air on FOX, which is free to access if you live near a local network affiliate. You only need an over-the-air (OTA) antenna that’s strong enough to pick up the channel’s signal. Then, you’ll get every matchup on FOX—including the MLS Cup Final—without paying a monthly subscription.

Of course, the antenna itself isn’t free. But it’s a one-time purchase that will last several seasons and provide live sports year-round—including MLB, NFL, and Premier League games.

We recommend the Mohu Leaf 50 because its 60-mile range and included amplifier are ideal for clear channel reception. But you’ll first want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to confirm a FOX affiliate is within range of your home.

If you require a wider-range antenna, visit our Best Antennas for Cord-Cutters page for more recommendations.

How to watch the MLS Playoffs FAQ

What channel is the MLS Cup Playoffs on?

The MLS Playoffs stream entirely on MLS Season Pass. But select playoff games also air on FOX Sports channels in the U.S., while TSN and RDS networks show some playoff matchups in Canada.

Where can I stream the MLS Playoffs?

You can stream every MLS playoff game on MLS Season Pass via the Apple TV app. Live TV streaming services that carry FOX and FS1 also provide access to select MLS games.

Does ESPN+ have the MLS Playoffs?

No, ESPN+ doesn‚Äôt have live MLS playoff games. Instead, you‚Äôll need an MLS Season Pass subscription to stream the complete MLS Cup Playoffs.

Does Apple TV have the MLS Playoffs?

Yes, you can watch the MLS Playoffs on Apple TV with an MLS Season Pass add-on subscription. Select playoff games may also stream on Apple TV+.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, examined the best ways to watch the MLS Playoffs by comparing the prices and channel offerings of the most popular TV services. He selected his English- and Spanish-language viewing recommendations based on convenience—focusing on channel availability, pricing, and ease of signing up.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: NBA Schedule This Week: Your Guide to the Best Week 4 Games on TV
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
CableTV.com‚Äôs NBA expert maps out the weekly TV schedule and breaks down the top games, key player matchups, and storylines so you know exactly what to watch.

The post NBA Schedule This Week: Your Guide to the Best Week 4 Games on TV appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Most NBA teams have played 10 games at this point of the season, and I’m starting to get a good sense of which teams are real, and which ones aren’t.

The Detroit Pistons have taken the East by storm (more on that later), the Dallas Mavericks have been surprisingly bad, and it seems like the Oklahoma City Thunder are actually far-and-away favorites for a repeat title. I’m keeping an eye on these teams every week from now on.

If you’re an NBA devotee, here’s what you should be checking out during the fourth week of the 2025–2026 NBA season, and what I thought of some of last week’s action.

Jump to:

  • National NBA game of the week
  • NBA League Pass game of the week
  • NBA schedule this week
  • League news and analysis

National NBA game of the week

Los Angeles Lakers at Oklahoma City Thunder | ESPN

I’m probably gonna recommend the Thunder a lot this season. They’re the defending champs, and they just keep winning even though Jalen Williams hasn’t played due to his recovery from an offseason wrist surgery—which is delayed, by the way.

On the Lakers side, this game is an early measuring stick for how good the team can be. If they get blown out, it’ll be a step back on their journey to being a championship contender. But if they can hang, or even win, that would instill a ton of confidence in themselves and their fan base.

How to watch Los Angeles Lakers at Oklahoma City Thunder
Date:
Wednesday, Nov. 12
Time: 9:30 p.m. ET
National channel: ESPN
Location: Paycom Center, Oklahoma City, OK

Stream with DIRECTV

Honorable mention: 

  • Golden State Warriors at San Antonio Spurs — NBA Cup (Friday, Nov. 14, 9:30 p.m. ET, Amazon Prime Video).

NBA League Pass game of the week

Brooklyn Nets at Washington Wizards| NBA League Pass

I’m going unconventional this week and recommending a game between two very, very bad teams. Now, why is that? Why would I do that? (Insert Brian Windhorst meme here.)

Simple: Someone has to win.

Nobody wants to see a bad team play against a good or even a mid team—it’ll most likely end in a boring blowout. But two bad teams often make for great theater. All their frustrations over losing will get sorted out at the expense of one another. It’s a slugfest between teams that can’t do more than slap fight.

My NBA watching generally consists of two great teams (or my favorite team) going at it so I can get the best viewing experience possible.

On this night, I choose violence.

How to watch Brooklyn Nets at Washington Wizards
Date:
Sunday, Nov. 16
Time: 6:00 p.m. ET
Local channels: YES, Monumental Sports Network
Out-of-market: NBA League Pass
Location: Capital One Arena, Washington, DC

Try League Pass

Honorable mention: 

  • Chicago Bulls at Detroit Pistons (Wednesday, Nov. 12, 7:00 p.m. ET).

What NBA games are on TV this week?

Swishes and airballs: My hot takes from NBA Week 3

Lots to muse about from keeping up with the third week of the 2025–2026 NBA season. Giddy up.

Swish: The Mind the Game conversation among LeBron James, Steph Curry, and Steve Nash. I tend to ignore this podcast and kind of forget it exists. But because James and Curry were on it together, I fired this one up. And man, it was so interesting to hear these three men talk basketball and enjoy each other’s company.

I know it’s not a traditional medium for conversations with NBA players, but I suggest you make some time to listen. If you love the NBA and what these three players have meant to the game in the last 25 to 30 years, you won’t regret it. The link to Part 1 of the conversation is below.

Airball: Walker Kessler’s season-ending injury. The Utah Jazz were always going to suck this season, and everyone knows it’s because they’re in a multiyear rebuilding process *cough* tanking *cough*. But Kessler is a cool dude and a very talented young player. I personally know people who have been around him while covering the team, and I’ve heard nothing but great things. Plus, the Jazz have been kinda fun this season. So losing him is a huge blow.

Swish: LeBron James is close to returning. The Lakers announced on Thursday, November 6, that he was cleared for contact basketball activities and he would be reevaluated in one to two weeks. That timeline still puts James on track to return mid-November.

TBD: The Pistons so far. I don’t know what to make of this team. They’ve won six straight games, vaulting themselves to the top of the Eastern Conference standings. But the six teams they’ve beaten to get there have a combined record of 21–39.

Good teams beat the teams they’re supposed to, and Detroit has certainly done that. But I’m just not ready to anoint them quite yet. I need to see more wins against quality teams. Case in point: The Pistons’ last loss was to the Cavs.

NBA schedule this week FAQ

When does the NBA season end?

The 2025‚Äì2026 NBA season ends Sunday, April 12, 2026.

How many games are in an NBA season?

The NBA season officially has 82 games. But since the addition of the NBA Cup, that number is technically 83 for the two teams that advance to the championship game of that tournament. The championship game doesn‚Äôt count as a regular-season game.

When is the NBA trade deadline?

The NBA trade deadline for the 2025‚Äì2026 season is February 6, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. ET.

Where can I watch Inside the NBA?

Inside the NBA will air on ABC and ESPN throughout the season. It will also include the show‚Äôs signature pregame and halftime shows.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports writer, Alex Vejar, is a passionate NBA fan who follows the league by watching multiple games per week. He analyzed the NBA schedule and made his viewing recommendations based on matchups, star power, style of play, and unique or interesting viewing experiences.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods for reviewing TV services.

Game day starts here!

This week‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhat To Watch‚Äù picks include the thriller A Very Jonas Christmas Movie (Disney+), the second seasons of The Creep Tapes (Shudder) and Palm Royale (Apple TV), Richard Linklater‚Äôs Nouvelle Vague (Netflix), and more. Let‚Äôs hit the couch!

The post What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (Nov. 10‚Äì16) appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
CableTV.com’s fall TV preview guide is here!

Embrace cozy season with the best fall TV! The TV experts at CableTV.com have curated a list of top fall TV shows to help you find something to binge-watch while the leaves drop.

New on TV this week

This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the 56th season of Sesame Street (Netflix, PBS), the second seasons of The Creep Tapes (Shudder) and Palm Royale (Apple TV), and the thriller The Beast in Me (Netflix).

We also recommend a Jonas Brothers Christmas special (Disney+), Richard Linklater’s Nouvelle Vague (Netflix), and Mr. K on video-on-demand (VOD). Let’s hit the couch!

Night owl? Peep what’s on late-night TV this week.

New on Apple TV+ this week

Palm Royale | Apple TV+ | Comedy, drama

Season 2 premiere, Wednesday, Nov. 12: The ultra-rich may be terrible to deal with in real life, but they’re endlessly entertaining in fiction. Kristen Wiig’s Apple TV dramedy is back with a deeper look into high-society scandals and schemes. Will Maxine lose herself on her quest to cross class lines?

Read Our Apple TV+ Review

Pro tip: Looking for more to watch? Check out Sophie Hastings’ article, October’s Netflix Recap: The 5 Shows I Couldn’t Stop Binge-Watching.

New on Netflix this week

The Beast in Me | Netflix | Drama, thriller

Limited series premiere, Thursday, Nov. 13: The Beast in Me is about a grieving writer named Aggie Wiggs (Claire Danes) who falls deep into the true crime rabbit hole—that is, investigating her suspiciously murder-y neighbor Nile Jarvis (Matthew Rhys). But is the beast in Nile or in Aggie? And how is Aggie Wiggs not a drag queen name?

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

See what to watch this weekend on all platforms

Click on your favorite streaming service below to see new releases and classic recommendations from our TV critics.

New on Shudder this week

The Creep Tapes | Shudder | Horror, comedy

Season 2 premiere, Friday, Nov. 14: Mark Duplass is back as a weirdo serial killer (is there any other kind?) obsessed with filming his own misdeeds. Watch as he lures in would-be filmmakers David Dastmalchian, Katie Aselton, and Robert Longstreet in this show’s bloody second season.

Best Shudder Original Movies

New on Netflix this week

Nouvelle Vague | Netflix | Drama, comedy

Movie, Friday, Nov. 14: If you love cinematic history and movies about movies, you’ll love this one. This artsy, black-and-white French film reimagines Jean-Luc Godard’s Breathless as a “playful” comedy in what Netflix is billing as a “poignant love letter to cinema.”

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

Want more new TV shows?

« Catch Up on the Best TV Shows of 2024
Discover the Best TV Shows of 2025 »

New on Disney+ this week

A Very Jonas Christmas Movie | Disney+ | Comedy, musical

Movie, Friday, Nov. 14: Have you ever seen Planes, Trains, and Automobiles? Have you ever wished it featured less Steve Martin and more 2000s teen heartthrobs? The Jo-Bros have you covered with this fictional account of the band’s Christmas adventures—much like the old Disney Channel show, Jonas.

Best Movies and Shows on Disney+

Looking for your next binge-watch?

« Binge an Entire Show This Weekend
Start a Classic Binge-Worthy Show »

New on Netflix this week

Sesame Street | Netflix, PBS | Kids, educational

Season premiere, Monday, Nov. 10: Sesame Street is back for its 56th season, and it belongs to the people once again! After Netflix bought the series from HBO, it returned distribution rights to PBS. That means you can watch new episodes for free on PBS the same day they air on Netflix.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

New movie releases available to rent/buy on VOD this week

Mr. K (2025) | Mystery, drama

The official blurb for this movie may call it “Kafkaesque,” but this Gen Z reporter knows what the genre is really called—“backrooms creepypasta.”

Okay, it’s a little more highbrow than that. In Mr. K, Crispin Glover plays a hapless magician who checks into a spooky old hotel. But when it’s time to leave, he has trouble finding the exit. Doors, walls, cupboards, and wardrobes—nothing in this hotel makes a lot of sense, least of all the people trapped there.

You can rent Mr. K from video-on-demand (VOD) outlets like Prime Video, Google Movies & TV, and Fandango at Home (formerly VUDU) as of Tuesday, Nov. 11.
